Package com.dffrs.memory.inMemoryCache

Class LRUCache<K,V>

java.lang.Object
com.dffrs.memory.inMemoryCache.LRUCache<K,V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
CacheInterface<K,V>
public final class LRUCache<K,V> extends Object implements CacheInterface<K,V>
Class implementing an "in memory" type cache. For that, it uses keyStoringMap, to store elements, as they are inserted into the LRUCache itself. It has a pre-defined size (through LRUCache(int)), and every time it reaches full capacity, with the help of valueStoringList list, evicts the least recently used element. All methods, beside removeElement(Object) and cacheHitAdd(Object, Object), are O(1) time complexity operations (Future updates may improve those as well).
Author:
dffrs

      public V get(K key)

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • addElement

      public boolean addElement(K key, V element)
      Method responsible for adding elements to the cache. If it is full, evictionProtocol() is called before adding a new item. If the cache already contains the new element to insert, it moves it's reference, inside valueStoringList, to the first place, meaning it is, now, the latest accessed item. On the other hand, if keyStoringMap does NOT contain any key for that element, it adds it to the first position by default (inside valueStoringList).
      Specified by:
      addElement in interface CacheInterface<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - Key used to reference the new item inside the cache.
      element - Element to add.
      Returns:
      True if element is added, False otherwise (for some reason).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When either argument is a NULL reference.

    • removeElement

      public boolean removeElement(K key)
      Method to remove a specific element, passed as argument.
      Specified by:
      removeElement in interface CacheInterface<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - K value used as reference to remove as specific item.
      Returns:
      True if removed succesfully, False otherwise or LRUCache is empty.
